Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Convection-Enhanced Delivery of Muscimol for Drug-Resistant Epilepsy

Trial_Design.evidence: In this phase 1 randomised controlled trial, 3 adult patients with DRE were recruited from a single center.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included adults with confirmed DRE.

Intervention.evidence: Participants underwent convection-enhanced delivery (CED) of artificial CSF vehicle followed by muscimol into the seizure focus for 12 to 24 hours using a crossover design.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was seizure frequency, assessed over the infusion period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Three patients were randomised, and all completed the study.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Three patients were randomised, and all completed the study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Seizure frequency decreased in 1 of 3 patients during muscimol infusion but was unchanged during vehicle infusion.
